div.p: A Gilbertine Abby dedicated to the blessed Virgin, and erected by Eustace fil. Iohannis, (temp. R. Steph.) It was rated at 360l. 16s. 10d. ob. per an. Dugd. 453l. 7•. 8d. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 2. p. 798.
* Reg. in Arce London.

div.head: 28. Malton.
div.p: The same Eustace Fitz-Iohn (temp. Reg. Steph.) built a Gilbertine Priory here to the honour of the blessed Virgin. It was endowed 197l. 19s. 2d. per an. Dugd. 257l. 1s. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 2. p. 816.
* Registr. in Bibl. Cotton.

div.head: 29. Fors.
div.p: Akarius Fitz-Bardolf A. D. 1145. founded here an Abby of Cistercian Monks, who were afterward translated to Iervall.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 869.

div.head: 30. Roch.
div.p: A Cistercian A Priory of the Cluniac Order, situated in Wiltshire▪ Re • ner. Abby founded by Rich. de Builli and Rich. Fitz-Turgis A. D. 1147. and dedicated to St. Mary. It was valued 26. Hen. VIII. at 224l. 2s. 5d. per an. Dugd. 71l. 19s. 4d. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 839.
* Collectiones MSS. Rogeri Dodsworthi in Bibl. Bodl. Vol. 9.

div.head: 31. Salley.
div.p: A. D. 1147. Will. Percy built a Cistercian Abby here to the honour of the blessed Virgin. It was able to dispend at the Suppression 147l. 3s. 10d. per an. Dugd. 221l. 15s. 8d. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 842.
Registr. in Bibl. Deuvesiana.
* Cartularium penes Franc. Darcy.

div.head: 32. Nun-Appleton.
div.p:
A Cistercian Nunnery founded by Adeliz de S. Quintin, (temp. R. Steph.) and commended to the Patronage of St. Iohn the Apostle. It was rated
26. Hen. VIII. at 73l. 9s. 10d. per an. Dugd. 83l. 5s. 9d. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 907.

div.head: 33. Middlesburgh.
div.p: Rob▪ de Brus (temp. R. Steph.) gave this Mannor to the Monks of Whitby, and so it became a Cell of Benedictines to that Abby. St. Hilda was likewise the Patroness of it.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 413.

div.head: 34. Kirkstall.
div.p: A. D. 1147. Henry Lacei built a Cistercian Abby here to the honour of the blessed Virgin. It was endowed with 329l. 2s. 11d. per an. Dugd. 512l. 13s. 4d. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 746, 854.
Chronica de Kirkstall a Bruto ad finem Henr. V. In Bibl. Cotton. Dom. A. 12.
* MS. de Fundatione Prior. de Kirkstall in Bibl. Bodl. Laud. G. 9.
* Reg. in Officio Ducatus Lanc.
* Collect. MS. Rog. Dodsworthi Vol. 8. 39.

div.head: 35. Arden.
div.p: The Priory of St. Andrew for Benedictine Nuns erected by Peter Hotun, (about A. D. 1150.) It was endowed with 12l. 6d. per an. Dugd. 13l. 7s. 4d. Sp.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 500.

div.head: 36. Keling.
div.p:
A Benedictine Nunnery built by Agnes de Archis to the honour of St. Mary and St. Helen. (temp.
R. Steph.) Its yearly revenues at the Dissolution were worth 35l. 15s. 5d. Dugd. 50l. 17s. 2d. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 474.
Registr. in Bibl. Cotton. Oth. C. 8.

div.head: 37. Melsa or Meaux.
div.p: A. D. 1150. William le Gross Earl of Albemarle founded a Cistercian Abby here, and dedicated it to the blessed Virgin. It was valued 26. Hen. VIII. at 299l. 6s. 4d. q. per an. Dugd. 445l. 10s. 5d. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. I. p. 792, 747.
Registr. in Bibl. Cotton.
* Collect. MSS. Rog. Dodsworthi in Bibl. Bodl. Vol. 110.
* Registra penes Christ. Hildiard de. ... in Holderness.
* Cartular. penes Will. Aldford de ead. Mil.
* Registr. penes Decan. & Capit. Eborac.

div.head: 38. Bolton.
div.p: A Priory of Black Canons valued at 212l. 3s. 4d. per an. translated hither A. D. 1151. by Alice de Romalli from Emmesey.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 2. p. 100.
* Reg. penes Will. Ingleby de Ripley mil.
* Collectiones MSS. Rog. Dodsworthi. In Bibl. Bodl. Vol. 8. 146.

div.head: 39. Richmond juxta.
div.p: A Premonstratensian Priory founded by Roald the Constable A. D. 1152. and dedicated to St. Agatha. Its annual income 26. Hen. VIII. amounted to 111l. 17s. 11d. Dugd. 188l. 16s. 2d. Sp.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 2. p. 649.

div.head: 40. Ierball.
div.p: A. D. 1156. the Cistercians at Fors were translated hither by Conan Duke of Britain. It was dedicated to St. Mary, and rated at the Suppression at 234l. 18s. 5d. per an. Dugd. 455l. 10s. 5d. Sp.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 869.
* Cartas penes Honoratiss. Thomam Com. Ailesburiensem.

div.head: 41. Woodkirk.
div.p: A Cell of Black Canons to Nostel, founded by William Earl of Warren, (temp. Hen. II.) It was dedicated to St. Mary, and its yearly revenues were worth at the Suppression 17l. 4d. Dugd. 47l. 4d. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 2. p. 41.

div.head: 42. Wilberfoss.
div.p: Alan de Catton (temp. Hen. II.) founded a Benedictine Nunnery here, and commended it to the Patronage of the blessed Virgin. It was able to dispend at the Dissolution 21l. 16s. 10d. per an. Dugd. 28l. 8s. 8d. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 524. T. 3. P. 1. p. 12.

div.head: 43. Yedingham or Littlemareis.
div.p: A Benedictine Nunnery built by Rog. de Clere, (temp. Hen. II.) to the honour of St. Mary. It was valued at 21l. 16s. 6d. per an. Dugd. 26l. 6s. 8d. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 496.

div.head: 44. York.
div.p: A Collegiate Church dedicated to the holy Sepulcher, and built by Roger Arch-bishop of York about A. D. 1170. for a Warden, four Priests, four Deacons, and four Subdeacons. It was valued 26. Hen. VIII. at 138l. 19s. 2d. ob. per an. Dugd. Speed.
Vide Thomae Stubbs Acta Pontificum Eborac. inter X. Script. Hist. Angl. Lond. 1652. col. 1723.

div.head: 45. North-Allerton.
div.p: An Alien-Priory to the Abby of Marmonstier in France, to which it was given by Rich. Malleverer, (temp. Hen. II.)
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 599.

div.head: 46. Hoton.
div.p: A Cistercian Nunnery founded by Ralph de Nevill, (temp. Hen. II.)
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 840.

div.head: 47. Mount S. Iohn.
div.p: A Preceptory of Knights Templers, to whom this Mannor was given by Robert Lord Ross, (temp. Hen. II.) Endowed with 102l. 13s. 2d. per an.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 2. p. 551.

div.head: 48. Drax.
div.p: A Priory of Black Canons founded by Will. Paynell, (temp. Hen. II.) and commended to the Patronage of St. Nicholas. Its yearly revenues were worth 104l. 14s. 9d. Dugd. 121l. 18•, 3d. ob. Sp.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 2. p. 96.
Cartul. pen. Marmad. Constable de Everingham.
* Collectiones MSS. Rogeri Dodsworthi in Bibl. Bodl. Vol. 8.

div.head: 49. Keldon or Keldeholm.
div.p: A Cistercian Nunnery dedicated to the blessed Virgin, and founded by Rob. de Stutevil, (temp. Hen. II.) It was valued at 29l. 6s. 1d. per an. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. I. p. 914.

div.head: 50. Rosedale.
div.p:
A Benedictine
A Cistercian Nunnery. MS. Bodl. Nunnery built by the said Rob. de Stutevil, to the honour of St. Mary and St. Laurence. It was endowed at the Dissolution with 37l. 12s. 5d. per an. Dugd. 41l. 13s. 8d. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 507.

div.head: 51. Senningthwait.
div.p: About A. D. 1160. Bertam Haget founded a Cistercian Nunnery here, and dedicated it to St. Mary. It was rated 26. Hen. VIII. at 60l. 9s. 2d. per an. Dugd. 62l. 6s. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 827.

div.head: 52. Pontfract.
div.p: A Cluniac Monastery founded by Rob. de Laci 5. Hen. II. Its tutelar Patron was St. Iohn the Evangelist. It was rated 26. Hen. VIII. at 337l. 14s. 8d. per an. Dugd. 472l. 16s. 1d. ob. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 648.
Cartular. penes Tho. Widdrington A. D. 1652.
* Registrum in manibus Joh. Wentworth de Wolley in Com. Ebor. Armig. cujus Apographum est penes V. Cl. Nath. Johnston M. D. de Pontfract.

div.head: 53. Hampoll.
div.p: A Cistercian Nunnery dedicated to the blessed Virgin, built by Avicia de Tanai about A. D. 1170. Its annual income amounted to 63l. 5s. 8d. Dugd. 85l. 6s. 11d. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 830.

div.head: 54. Ribleston.
div.p: This Mannor was given to the Knights Templers by Robert Lord Ross, (temp. Hen. II.) so it became a Preceptory, having rents (26. Hen. VIII.) to the value of 207l. 9s. 7d. per an.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 2. p. 551, 557.

div.head: 55. Marton.
div.p: Bertam de Bulmer (temp. Hen. II.) built a Priory of Black Canons here to the honour of the blessed Virgin. It was rated 26. Hen. VIII. at 151l. 5s. 4d. per an. Dugd. 183l. 2s. 4d. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 2. p. 98.

div.head: 56. Monks-Bretton.
div.p: Adam Fitz-Swain about A. D. 1186. founded a Monastery of the Cluniac Order here, subordinate to the Priory of St. Iohn at Pontfract, and dedicated it to St. Mary Magdalene. Its yearly revenues at the Suppression amounted to 239l. 3s. 6d. Dugd. 323l. 8s. 2d. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 660.
Cartularium in Bibl. Cotton. Claudius. A. 8.
Registr. penes Franc. Wortley Mil.
* Registr. penes Joh. Wentworth de Wolley Arm.
* Registr. penes Will. Armyn Mil.
* Collect. MSS. Rog. Dodsworthi. In Bibl. Bodl. Vol. 155. 159.

div.head: 57. Molesby.
div.p: A Priory of Nuns of St. Austin's Order subordinate to Marton, founded by King Henry II. and dedicated to the blessed Virgin. It was valued 26. Hen. VIII. at 26l. 2s. 10d. per an. Dugd. 32l. 6s. 2d. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 3. P. 1. p. 98.
* Collect. MSS. Rogeri Dodsworthi. In Bibl. Bodl. Oxon. Vol. 10.

div.head: 58. Swainby.
div.p: A Priory of Premonstratensian Canons founded A. D. 1190. by Helewisia de Glanvill, but translated to

div.head: 59. Coverham.
div.p: By Ranulf de Glanvill the famous Lawyer, 14. Ioh. It was dedicated to St. Mary, and endowed with 160l. 18s. 3d. per an. Dugd. 207l. 14s. 8. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 2. p. 648.

div.head: 60. York.
div.p:
A Gilbertine Priory founded by Hugh Murdac about A. D. 1200. St. Andrew was its Tutelar
Patron. It was valued 26. Hen. VIII. at 47l. 14s. 3d. ob. per an. Dugd. 57l. 5s. 9d. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 2. p. 808.

div.head: 61. Ellerton.
div.p: A Priory of the Sempringham Order built by W. Fitz-Peter, (temp. R. Ioh.) to the honour of the blessed Virgin. It was able to dispend at the Suppression 62l. 8s. 10d. per an. Dugd. 78l. 10d. Sp.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 2. p. 821. T. 3. P. 1. p. 108.

div.head: 62. Grosmunt.
div.p: A Priory subordinate to the Abby of Grandmont in France, founded by Ioanna the wife of Rob. de Turnham, (temp. R. Ioh.) It was rated at 12l. 1s. 8d. per an. Dugd. 14. 2s. 8d. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 597. T. 3. P. 1. p. 15.

div.head: 63. Thirkehead.
div.p: Rog. fil. Rogeri (temp. R. Ioh.) founded a Benedictine Nunnery here and dedicated it to S. Mary. It was endowed with 20l. 18s. 10d. per an. Dugd. 23l. 12s. 2d. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 529.

div.head: 64. Wyckham.
div.p: A Cistercian Abby erected by Paganus de Wickham (temp. R. Ioh.) and commended to the Patronage of St. Michael. It was rated 26. Hen. VIII. at 25l. 17s. 6d. per an. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 916.

div.head: 65. Helagh-Park.
div.p: A. D. 1218. Bertram Haget built a Priory of Black Canons here to the honour of St. Iohn the Evangelist. Its yearly revenues at the Dissolution amounted to 72l. 10s. 7d. per an. Dugd. 86l. 5s. 9d. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 2. p. 286.
Cartular. MS. in Bibl. Cotton.
* Registr. penes Dominum Wharton.

div.head: 66. Knaresburgh.
div.p: A Priory of the Order of the holy Trinity for the Redemption of Captives, founded by Rich. Earl of Cornwall, A. D. 1218. Saint Robert was the Tutelar Saint of this Monastery. It was valued at 35l. 10s. 11d. per an.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 2. p. 833.

div.head: 67. Newland.
div.p: A Preceptory founded by Roger of Poictou, 9. Edw. 1. Valued at 129l. 14s. 11d. ob. per an.
Vide Rog. Dodsworthi Collectiones MSS. in Bibl. Bodl. Vol. 10.

div.head: 68. Hedley.
div.p: A Cell to the Monastery of the holy Trinity at York.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 595.

div.head: 69. Gilling.
div.p: A Nunnery. Speed.

div.head: 70. Maryke.
div.p: A Benedictine Nunnery dedicated to St. Andrew, MS. Bodl. and founded by ... Aske Leland. Itin. Vol. 5. f. 96.. Valued at 48l. 18s. 3d. per an. Dugd. 64l. 16s. 9d. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 484.

div.head: 71. Beverley.
div.p: On the East side of the Town was a House of the Trinity belonging to the Knight Hospitalers of St. Iohn of Ierusalem. Ibid. Vol. 1. f. Valued at 167l. 10s. per an. Speed.

div.head: 72. Arthington.
div.p: A Cluniac Nunnery, rated 26. Hen. VIII. at 11l. 8s. 4d. ob. per an. Dugd. 19l. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 691.

div.head: 73. Basedale,
div.p: A Cistercian Nunnery dedicated to St. Mary. Endowed with 20l. 1s. 4d. per an. Dugd. 21l. 19s. 4d. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 840.

div.head: 74. Esseholt.
div.p: A Priory of Cistercians subordinate to Sinning-thwait. Valued at 13l. 5s. 4d. Dugd 19l. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 828.

div.head: 75. Ferreby.
div.p: A Priory rated at 60l. 1s. 2d. per an. Dugd. 95l. 11s. 7d. ob. Speed.

div.head: 76. Handale or Grundale.
div.p: A Benedictine Nunnery. Endowed at the Suppression with 13l. 1s. 7d. per an. Dugd. 20l. 7s. 8d. Sp.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 427.

div.head: 77. Kirkley.
div.p: A Benedictine Munnery built by Reynerus Flandrensis, to the honour of the blessed Virgin, A. D. ... Its yearly revenues at the Dissolution were worth 19l. 8s. 1d. Dugd. 20l. 7s. 8d. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 487.

div.head: 78. Ecclesfield.
div.p: An Alien-Priory to St. Wandragisilius's Abby in Normandy.

div.head: 79. Scarburgh.
div.p: An Alien-Priory.

div.head: 80. Nun-Burnham, Dugd. Nunvertholm Sp.
div.p: A Benedictine Nunnery. Valued at 8l. 1s. 11d. per an. Dugd. 10l. 3s. 3d. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 498.

div.head: 81. Swinhey.
div.p: A Cistercian A Benedictine Nunnery. MS. Bodl. Nunnery founded by Erinburch de Burtona to the honour of the blessed Virgin. Endowed with 82l. 3s. 9d. ob. per an. Dugd. 134l. 6s. 9d. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 834. 1026.

div.head: 82. Scarthe.
div.p: A Cell of Black Canons to Gisburn, to which it was given by Stephen de Mainillo.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 2. p. 153.

div.head: 83. Cotingham.
div.p: Thomas Lord Wake Not Thomas Holland Earl of Kent as in Speed. (15. Edw. II.) built a Priory of Black Canons here, translated 19. Ed. II. to

div.head: 84. Haltemprice.
div.p: Which was dedicated in honour of the Nativity of Christ, the Annunciation of the blessed Virgin, and the Exaltation of the holy Cross. It was endowed at the Suppression with 100l. 3d. ob. per an. Dugd. 178l. 10d. ob. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 2. p. 347.

div.head: 85. Hull.
div.p: A. D. 1378. Michael de la Pole Earl of Suffolk, founded a Cartusian Priory here, and commended it to the Patronage of St. Mary, St. Michael, and S. Thomas of Canterbury. It was rated 26. Hen. VIII. at 174l. 18s. 3d. per an. Dugd. 231l. 17s. 3d. Sp.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 966. T. 2. p. 930.

div.head: 86. Pontfract.
div.p: Sir Rob. Knolles Knight, (8. Rich. II.) founded a College here and dedicated it to the holy Trinity. Its annual income at the Dissolution was worth 182l. 14s. 7d.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 3. P. 2. p. 106.
* Cartas, Remembrantias & munimenta pertinentia ad hoc Coll. & Domum eleemosinariam ejusdem inter MSS. Barlov. in Bibl. Bodl.

div.head: 87. Bolton.
div.p: A College endowed by Sir Rich. le Scrope Knt. 20. Rich. II. Its yearly revenues at the Suppression were worth 102l. 9s. 3d. Speed. This revenue is falsly said by Speed to belong to a House of Friers Carmelites here.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 3. P. 2. p. 137.

div.head: 88. Wenslow
div.p: A College dedicated to the holy Trinity, and founded by the said Sir Rich. le Scrope. 22. Ric. II.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 3. P. 2. p. 137.

div.head: 89. Hull.
div.p: A College of Prebendaries, founded as Leland Leland. It in. Vol. 1. f. thinks, by Walter Shirlaw Bishop of Durham, about A. D. 1400.

div.head: 90. Hemyngburgh.
div.p: A College founded by the Prior and Convent of Durham, (5. Hen. VI.) to the honour of the blessed Virgin, for a Provost, three Canons, six Vicars, and six Clerks. Valued at 36l. 7d. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 3. P. 2. p. 97.

div.head: 91. Mountgrace.
div.p:
Thomas de Holland Duke of Surrey founded here a Monastery for Carthusians, and dedicated
it to the blessed Virgin and St. Nicholas, 19. Hen. VI. it was valued at 323l. 2s. 10d. ob. per an.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 968.

div.head: 92. Middleham.
div.p: A College dedicated to St. Mary and St. Alkilda, founded by Rich. Duke of Glocester, 17. Ed. IV.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 3. P. 2. p. 204.

div.head: 93. Roderham.
div.p: Thomas Rotherham Arch-bishop of York, (22. Edw. IV.) built a Collegiate Church here to honour of Christ Iesus. It consisted to a Provost, five Priests, six Choristers, a Musick-master, a Schoolmaster, and a Writing-master,Leland. It in. Vol. 5. f. 78. and was endowed 26. Hen. VIII. with 58l. 5s. 9d. ob. q. per an.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 3. P. 2. p. 204.

div.head: 94. Aulcaster.
div.p: A College dedicated to St. Mary and St. Iohn Baptist, founded by Rob. Earl of Leicester, Speed., ... and was able to dispend at the Suppression 27l. 13s. 4d. per an. Speed.

div.head: 95. Sutton.
div.p: A College endowed with 13l. 8s. 8d. per an.

div.head: 96. Hoveden.
div.p: A College of ten Prebendaries. Liber MS. in Bibl. Bodl. Cromwell 129.

div.head: 97. Pontfract.
div.p: In the Castle here was a College dedicated to St. Clement, consisting of a Dean and three PrebendariesLeland. It in. Vol. 1. f..

☞ The Monasticon placeth Sibthorp in this County, which is in Notinghamshire; and Mr. Speed reckons Wederhall and Sempringham to be in this County, whereas the former is in Cumberland, and the latter in Lincolnshire.

div.head: 1. Holy-Head or Caer-Guby.
div.p: S. Chebius who flourished about A. D. 380. founded a little Monastery here. But this being destroyed, here was afterward a College of Prebendaries,Leland. Collect. Vol. 4. p. 54. whose yearly revenues at the Dissolution amounted to 24l. per an. Dugd.

div.head: 1. Brecknock.
div.p: A Priory of Benedictines subordinate to Battel Abby: it was built by Bernard de Newmarch (temp. Hen. I.) to the honour of St. Iohn the Evangelist, and endowed at the Suppression with 112l. 14s. 2d. per an. Dugd. 134l. 11s. 4d. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 319.

div.head: 2. Brecknock.
div.p: A College of 14. Prebendaries, translated hither by King Hen. VIII. from Aberguilly in Caermarden- shire.

div.head: 1. Kydwelly.
div.p: A Priory of Benedictines founded by Roger Bishop of Sarum about A. D. 1130. It was subordinate to Shirborn in Dorsetshire, and rated at 29l. 10s. per an.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 424.

div.head: 2. Alba-landa, Whiteland, or Blancland.
div.p: Iohn de Toryton (temp. R. Iohan.) built a Cistercian Abby here to the honour of St. Mary. Its yearly revenues at the Dissolution were worth 135l. 3s. 6d. Dugd 153l. 17s. 2d. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 884. T. 2. p. 918.

div.head: 3. Lancadanc.
div.p: A Collegiate Church consisting of a Precentor and one and twenty Canons, founded by Thomas Bishop of St. Davids A. D. 1283.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 3. P. 2. p. 36.

div.head: 4. Aberguilly.
div.p: A Collegiate Church founded by Thomas Bek Bishop of St. Davids, in which he placed two and twenty PrebendariesLeland.. Valued 26. Hen. VIII. at 42l.

div.head: 5. Tallach.
div.p:
A Benedictine It was a Premonstratensian Monastery according to Leland. Abby dedicated to the blessed
Virgin and St. Iohn the Baptist. It was valued at 136l. 9s. 7d. per an. Dugd. 153l. 1s. 4d. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 465.

div.head: 6. St. Clare.
div.p: An Alien-Priory, consisting of a Prior and three Cluniac Monks, Cell to St. Martin de Campis in Paris, and afterwards given to All-Souls College in Oxford.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 1026.

div.head: 7. Caermarden.
div.p: A Priory of Black Canons dedicated to St. Iohn the Evangelist. Endowed at the Suppression with 164l. 4d. per an.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 282.

div.head: 8. Teguin or Taue.
div.p: An Abby of White Monks. Lel.
☞ Mr. Speed placeth Llanleir in this County which should be in Cardiganshire.

div.head: 1. Aber-Conway.
div.p: A. D. 1185. Llewellin fil. Gervasii Prince of North-Wales, built a Cistercian Abby here to the honour of the blessed Virgin and All-Saints. It was rated 26. Hen. VIII. at 162l. 15s. per an. Dugd. 179l. 10s. 10d. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 918.

div.head: 2. Clunokvaur.
div.p: A Cistercian Abby founded by one Guithin, Uncle to a Prince of North-Wales, A. D. ... Its Tutelar Saint was St. Benow.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 892. T. 2. p. 919.

div.head: 3. Bethkelert.
div.p: A Priory of Black Canons founded by Llewellin the last Prince of Wales about A. D. 1260. and commanded to the Patronage of the blessed Virgin. It was endowed with 70l. 3s. 8d. per an. Dugd. 69l. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 2. p. 100.

div.head: 4. Bardsey.
div.p: An Abby dedicated to St. Mary. Its yearly revenues at the Dissolution were worth 46l. 1s. 4d. ob. Dugd. 58l. 6s. 2d. Speed.

div.head: 5. Penmon or Glannach.
div.p: A Priory of Black Canons dedicated to St. Mary. It was valued at 40l. 17s. 9d. ob. per an.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 2. p. 338.

div.head: 6. Siriolis. Sp.
div.p: A Priory rated at 47l. 14s. 3d. per an. Speed.

div.head: 1. Stratflour.
div.p: A. D. 1164. Resus Prince of South-Wales built a Cistercian Abby here. Its yearly revenues at the Dissolution amounted to 118l. 7s. 3d. Dugd. 122l. 6s. 8d. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 893.

div.head: 2. Cardigan.
div.p: A Priory of Black Monks, subordinate to the Abby of Chertsey in Surrey. Leland. It in. Vol. 5. f. 16. Valued at 13l. 4s. 9d. per an.

div.head: 3. Llanleir or Llan-Clere.Mr. Speed is under a mistake about this Priory, taking it to be the • ame with St. Clare, he has placed it in Caermardenshire.
div.p: A Cistercian Nunnery, Cell to Stratflour. Leland ut supra. Valued at 57l. 5s. 4d. Dugd. Speed.

div.head: 4. Llandewi-brevy.
div.p: A College of a Dean and twelve Prebendaries, founded by Thomas Bek Bishop of St. Davids. Leland. It in. Vol. 5. f. 16.

div.head: 5. Llanrustyt.
div.p: A Nunnery. Lel.

div.head: 6. Llansanfride.
div.p: Leland Ibid. thinks this to be the Nunnery that Giralaus calls Llanfride.

div.head: 1. De Ualle Crucis.
div.p: A Cistercian Abby founded by Madok ap Griffith about A. D. 1170. and dedicated to the blessed Virgin. It was endowed with 188l. 8s. per an. Dugd. 214l. 3s. 5d. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 945.

div.head: 2. Ruthin,
div.p: A Cell of Bonhommes. Lel.

div.head: 3. Wrexham.
div.p: A Collegiate Church. Lel.

div.head: 1. St. Asaph.
div.p: KEntigern a Scot, about A. D. 560. founded a Monastery between the Rivers Elwyd and Elwy, which shortly after became an Episcopal Seat, called in Latin Episcopatus Elguensis, Eluensis or Llan-Elwensis, and since Asaphensis, from St. Asaph successor to Kentigern in this See.
Vide Fr. Godwinum de Praesulibus Angliae. Lond. 1616. 4•. p. 652.
* Registra, Cartas, &c. penes Episcopum & Capit.

div.head: 2. Basingwerk.
div.p: A. D. 1131. Ranulph Earl of Chester founded an Abby of White Canons here, and dedicated it to St. Mary. It was rated 26. Hen. VIII. at 150l. 7s. 3d. per an. Dugd. 157l. 15s. 2d. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 720.

div.head: 3. Hawston.
div.p: A Preceptory, valued at 160l. 14s. 10d. per an.

div.head: 1. Landaff.
div.p: HEre has been a Cathedral Church ever since the time of St. Dubritius, who was made Bishop here about A. D. 520.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 3. P. 1. p. 188.
Historiam de Fundatione & Dotatione Ecclesiae Landaviensis, editam a Cl. Whartono in Angliae Sacrae Tom. 2. Lond. 1691. Fol.
* Registra, &c. penes Episcopum & Capitulum.

div.head: 2. Margan.
div.p: A. D. 1147. Robert Not William Earl of Gloucester as in Speed. Earl of Gloucester built a Benedictine A Cistercian Priory. MS. Bodl. Priory here to the honour of the blessed Virgin. It was rated 26. Hen. VIII. at 181l. 7s. 4d. per an. Dugd. 188l. 14s. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 477.
Annales de Margan editas per V. Rev. Thomam Gale. Oxon. 1687. Fol.

div.head: 3. Wenny.
div.p: A Cell to Gloucester Abby, thereunto given by Maurice de London, Founded by Sir Iohn de Loundres Knt. Lord of Ogmore Castle. Leland. A. D. 1141. It was dedicated to St. Michael.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 114.

div.head: 4. Neth.The fairest Abby in Wales, saith Leland.
div.p: A Cistercian Abby founded by Richard de Grainvill about A. D. 1150. and dedicated to the Holy Trinity. It was endowed with 132l. 7s. 7d. ob. per an. Dugd. 150l. 4s. 6d. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 719.
Registr. penes Edw. Stradling Mil.

div.head: 5. Swansey.
div.p: A Preceptory of the Templers. Valued at 20l. per an.

div.head: 6. Llangenith.
div.p: An Alien-Priory to the Abby of St. Taurinus at Eureux. After the Dissolution it was annexed by Henry Chichely Arch-bishop of Canterbury to All-Souls College in Oxon.
* Vide Cartas ad hunc Prioratum spectantes in Thesaurario Coll. Omn. Anim. Oxon.

div.head: 1. KimmerThis Abby is confounded by the Monasticon with Combehire in Rad • or-shire. .
div.p: A Cistercian Abby dedicated to St. Mary and founded by Llewellin fil. Gervasii about A. D. 1190.So Mr. Speed, but the foundation was only 〈◊〉 by this Lewellin, who was Prince of North-Wales Its yearly revenues were worth 51l. 13s. 4d. Dugd. 58l. 15s. 4d. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 825.

div.head: 1. Strat-Margell.
div.p: A. D. 1170. MadocNot Owen ap Griffith as in Speed. ap Griffith founded a Cistercian Abby here. It was valued 26. Hen. VIII. at 64l. 14s. 2d. per an Dugd. 73l. 7s. 3d. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 895.

div.head: 2. Llanlugan.
div.p: A Nunnery rated at 22l. 14s. 8d. per an.

div.head: 1. St. David's ol. Menevia.
div.p: HEre was the Seat of an Arch-bishop, who was Primate of Wales, from the time of St. David, who translated it hither from Caerleon, about A. D. 540. till S. Sampson about A. D. 930. carried the Pall with him to Dole in Britanny. Notwithstanding the Bishops of this See had Archiepiscopal power till the time of King Henry I. in whose reign Bernard Bishop of St. David's made profession of his subjection to the Arch-bishop of Canterbury as his Metropolitan.
Vide Godwin. de Praesulibus Angliae. p. 599.
Angliae Sacrae T. 2. in quo extant Annales Ecclesiae Menevensis, & Giraldus Cambrensis de jure & statu Menevensis Ecclesiae.
* Registra, Cartas & alia munimenta penes Episcopum & Capitulum.

div.head: 2. S. Dogmaël.
div.p: A Benedictine Priory subordinate to S. Martin at Tours, to which it was given by Robert Fitz-Martin A. D. 1126. It was endowed at the Suppression with 87l. 8s. 6d. per an. Dugd. 68l. 1s. 6d. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 444.

div.head: 3. Pilla.
div.p:
An Alien-Priory dedicated to St. Mary and St. Budoc, and Cell to the Abby of St. Martin at
Tours, to which it was given by Adam de Rupe.
Its yearly revenues 26. Hen. VIII. amounted to 52l. 2s. 5d.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 1019.

div.head: 4. Daverford.
div.p: A Priory of Black Canons dedicated to St. Mary and St. Thomas the Martyr. It was valued 26. Hen. VIII. at 133l. 11s. 1d. per an. Dugd. 135l. 6s. 1d. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 2. p. 292.

div.head: 5. Slebach.
div.p: A Preceptory valued at 184l. 10s. 11d. ob. per an.

div.head: 6. St. Davids.
div.p: A College of a Master and seven Priests, founded by Iohn Duke of Lancaster A. D. 1365. Its yearly revenues were worth 106l. 3s. 6d. Speed.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 2. p. 112.

div.head: 7. Mounton in the Suburbs of Pembroke.
div.p: A Priory of Black Monks Cell to St. Albans, founded by Humphrey Duke of Gloucester, (temp. Hen. VI.) Leland.

div.head: 8. Caldey.
div.p: In this Isle was a Cell of the Order of St. Dogmael. Ibid.

div.head: 1. CombehireFalsly said to be in Pembrokeshire by the Monasticon.
div.p: A Cistercian Priory founded by Cadwathel and ap Madoc A. D. 1143. It was rated 26. Hen. VIII. at 24l. 19s. 4d. per an.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 825.

div.head: 1. Russin.
div.p: A. D. 1134. Olave King of Man founded a Cistercian Abby here to the honour of the blessed Virgin. It was subordinate to Fourness in Lancashire. A. D. 1192. the Monks removed to

div.head: 2. Douglass.
div.p: Where they continued four years, and then return'd to Russin.
Vide Mon. Angl. T. 1. p. 710.

div.head: The Names of the Monasteries that were dissolv'd by a Bull of Pope Clement VII. A. D. 1524. and granted by King Henry VIII. to Cardinal Wolsey Arch-bishop of York, toward the erecting of two Collges, one at Ipswich, and the other at Oxford.

list.item: De Calceto near Arundel in Sussex.

list.head: Beside these, were dissolv'd by a Bull of the same Pope A. D. 1528. 20. Hen. VIII.
list.item: St. Peters at Ipswich in Suffolk.

list.head: To which may be added
list.item: The Hospitall of St. Wolstan at Worcester.
The Hospitall of St. Iames at Alverton in Yorkshire.

div.head: Before the Dissolution the following Abbats and Priors sat in the Upper House of Parliament, as Barons of this Kingdom.

list.head: The Abbats of
list.item: The Prior of St. John of Jerusalem, who was stiled primus Angliae Baro.

div.head: ERRATA.
div.p:
PAge 7. l. 1. of is wanting. p. 16. l. 3. and p. 68. l. 20. p. 73. l. 21. for M. A. read B. D. p. 35. l. 21. for Lowther read Whitehaven. p. 56. l. 20. Lindisfarn. p. 69. l. 29. strike out again. p. 71. l. 9. leave out it. p. 74. l. 13. VVilliam Cannings is upon the authority of Speed mentioned as Founder of VVestbury College, whereas he is only Dean; who was the Founder I cannot learn, but Iohn Carpenter Bishop of V • orcester was a great Benefactor to it about A. D. 1450. See Godwin de Pr • sulibus Angliai. p. 519. p. 85. l. 16. read Dominum. p. 137. l. 21. leave out it. p. 145. l. 6. for at read with. p. 176. l. 27. for Edw. II. read Edw. IV. p. 178. l. ult. & p. 180. l. 19. Historia a Fundationis Abbatiarum de Oseney & S. Fridiswid. Oxon. que dicitur esse penes Henr. Worsley de Hosp. Lincoln. Arm. est peculium Viri summ • industria & Oxoniensium Antiquitatum restauratoris Antonii Wood A. M. quem penes sunt plurim • Cartae Originales spectantes ad Abbatias & Frioratus de Oseney & Tame in Com. Oxon. Tickford, Nutley, Caldwell, & Ravenston in Com. Ruck. S. Nichol. de Tiptree, Blackmore & Stanesgate in Com. Essex. Tunbridge, Lesnes, & Begham ix Com. Cant. Daventre in Com. Northamp. Canwell in Com. Staff. Walingford in Com. Berk. de Calceto juxt • Arundell in Com. Suss. p. 191. l. 21. for 1131. read 1411. p.
• 29. l. 3. for Sim. read Iac. p. 270. l. 15. for Shirla •
read Skirlaw.
